summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report summarizing an interview conducted on August 21, 2019, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) officer from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The officer discusses his role, schedule, and his last interaction with Jeffrey Epstein on August 9, 2019, the day before Epstein was found dead in his cell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found hanging in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019. The document records the officer's last interaction with him on August 9.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was released prior to August 9, 2019, prompting the officer to inform Epstein he would need a new cellmate.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center prior to being released.

events.title: Officer's Last Interaction with Epstein
events.description: A BOP officer informs Jeffrey Epstein that he will need a new cellmate because Reyes has been released.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found hanging in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Officer
events.description: FBI and OIG agents interview a Federal Bureau of Prisons officer regarding his knowledge and interactions with Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: A Federal Bureau of Prisons officer was interviewed on August 21, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.
The officer's last interaction with Epstein was on August 9, 2019, when he informed Epstein he would need a new cellmate because Reyes had been released.
Epstein was found hanging in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.
The officer was not working when Epstein initially arrived at MCC or when Epstein was found dead.
The document is an FBI 302 report, indicating it is a record of an interview conducted as part of an investigation.
